title: Researchers uncover new structures at plant-fungal interface

title_detail.value: Researchers uncover new structures at plant-fungal interface

summary: For millions of years, plants and fungi have exchanged crucial nutrients such as phosphate and fatty acids, but the mechanism by which this exchange happens has been poorly understood. Now, researchers have uncovered structural networks of tubules at the plant-fungal interface that could shed light on the mechanisms of this symbiotic partnership.
